channel.title: Black Mesa created using source 2 engine?
channel.description:
Hello guys. Earlier this year valve announced source 2 engine, and that it will be free.
Will Black Mesa be considered to be re-created using source 2 engine?

item.title: Black Mesa created using source 2 engine?
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
sansuni:

So… you are saying that you guys are making HALF-LIFE 3? YEEEAAAHH. Half-Life 3 confirmed you guys…

Calm down. It was just a joke and no need to act like this. Perhaps it will be ported to Source 2 one day, perhaps it never will, perhaps it will get cancelled soon, perhaps it will be picked the game of the year.

We are just talking, but if you don’t want that, thats fine.

There’s no need to play the victim. The phrase grasping at straws comes to mind with this particular topic. We welcome discussion about anything BMS related on these forums, but as we’ve pretty decisively shot down the idea of a Source 2 port (on multiple occasions), I don’t really see how there’s any more productive discussion to be had.

Sarcasm and jokes don’t often come across very well over the internet, where tone can’t be adequately conveyed. It certainly didn’t come across as a joke to me, because I’ve seen people make similar logical leaps from sentences like that. I’m not trying to stifle discussion so much as trying to prevent wildfires. I am fine with talking, but have witnessed first hand how a simple discussion like this can very quickly expand into far more than intended, as with the initial Source 2 rumours. I am wary of that.

Feel free to talk about anything else.

Read full topic
item.source: Black Mesa created using source 2 engine?

item.title: Black Mesa created using source 2 engine?
item.dc:creator: sansuni
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:

We’re not. Crazy speculation like this only leads to disappointment, just like the rumours we were on Source 2 initially. If something secret was going on in the background, we just wouldn’t comment on any of this, and keep it quiet. Nothing is happening, or will happen.
I mean it. Stop. Stuff like this very quickly gets out of hand and spread around as misinformation.

So… you are saying that you guys are making HALF-LIFE 3? YEEEAAAHH. Half-Life 3 confirmed you guys…

Calm down. It was just a joke and no need to act like this. Perhaps it will be ported to Source 2 one day, perhaps it never will, perhaps it will get cancelled soon, perhaps it will be picked the game of the year.

We are just talking, but if you don’t want that, thats fine.

Read full topic

I mean it. Stop. Stuff like this very quickly gets out of hand and spread around as misinformation.

item.source: Black Mesa created using source 2 engine?

item.title: Black Mesa created using source 2 engine?
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
TextFAMGUY1:

No, actually. I’m saying it will never happen, but putting it in such a way so that on the unbelievably microscopic chance something were to happen in the future (which it won’t), I won’t look like a total mug.

Read full topic
item.source: Black Mesa created using source 2 engine?

item.title: Black Mesa created using source 2 engine?
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
sansuni:
TextFAMGUY1:

Unless a series of extremely unlikely and complicated scenarios all unfold perfectly, and the stars and moon align in perfect harmony, we won’t be porting to Source 2. Porting from Source 2007 --> TF2 was enough to make most of us want to quit forever.

So… you are saying that it could happen… someday. Just very unlikely. Hmmm… Perhaps if the Source 2 engine had a conversion tool… (Source 1 to Source 2 type of thing. You know, for easy porting. ) Very unlikely though…

No, actually. I’m saying it will never happen, but putting it in such a way so that on the unbelievably microscopic chance something were to happen in the future (which it won’t), I won’t look like a total mug.

Read full topic
item.source: Black Mesa created using source 2 engine?

item.title: Black Mesa created using source 2 engine?
item.dc:creator: sansuni
item.description:
Crypt:

Much like a new installment in the Half-Life series.

I imagine programming would be a larger issue than general asset conversion (though depending on what type of rendering S2 uses, many textures could be not ideal).

“You know nothing Jon Snow!” Err… What I mean is, until the engine gets a proper release we wont know if it would be feasible to port the game or not. Who knows, perhaps even Valve could do it (or rather make a 3rd party do it), since I am pretty sure they will re-release their old games such as Half-Life 2 and it is episodes, along with Team Fortress 2, Counter Strike Global Offensive and Portal 1-2 etc. I am basing this on how they kept porting these games on newer version of the Source engine and how they are already porting Dota 2 as Dota 2 Reborn. Maybe they would make a OrangeBox 2.0 to release it on Next-gen consoles, with all these games and maybe it would include Black Mesa instead of Half-Life Source. Who knows… They even ported the original Half-life to Source engine and that says something.

Read full topic

item.description:
